meanings.definition: The act of beating or pounding.
meanings.sent1: The batterie of the drums echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a batterie to mix the ingredients for the cake.
meanings.sent3: The batterie of rain on the roof made it hard to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a batterie, thumping loudly in her chest.
meanings.sent5: The batterie of waves against the shore was calming.

meanings.definition: A set of drums or percussion instruments.
meanings.sent1: The school band had a batterie that played at the football games.
meanings.sent2: The batterie in the music studio was well-tuned and ready for the concert.
meanings.sent3: The batterie in the corner seemed to be calling out to be played.
meanings.sent4: The batterie of drums added a lively rhythm to the song.
meanings.sent5: The batterie of instruments created a symphony of sound.

meanings.definition: A series of connected electrical cells.
meanings.sent1: The batterie in the flashlight needed new batteries.
meanings.sent2: The batterie in the car kept the engine running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The batterie in the remote control died at the worst time.
meanings.sent4: The batterie of solar panels powered the entire house.
meanings.sent5: The batterie of devices needed to be charged overnight.
